doc:
Mabel Barrison https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mabel_Barrison 0 Mabel Barrison (April 21, 1882 - November 1, 1912) was a Canadian born American stage actress and singer in the first decade of the 20th century. She was born "Eva Farrance" and joined a musical chorus while still in her teens. She appeared in vaudeville and on Broadway with Weber and Fields and was spotted by stage director Julian Mitchell for a role in the 1903 "Babes in Toyland". "The Blue Mouse" was written by Clyde Fitch and Fitch himself selected Barrison for a role in the play. Barrison was plagued by health problems the last two years of her life. She died on November 1, 1912 in Toronto at the age of 30. Mabel_Barrison ( April_21_,_1882 - November_1_,_1912 ) was a_Canadian_born_American_stage_actress_and_singer in the_first_decade of the_20th_century . She was_born " Eva_Farrance " and joined a_musical_chorus while still in her_teens . She appeared in vaudeville and on Broadway with Weber_and_Fields and was_spotted by stage_director_Julian_Mitchell for a_role in the_1903 " Babes in Toyland_" . " The_Blue_Mouse " was_written by Clyde_Fitch and Fitch himself selected Barrison for a_role in the_play . Barrison was_plagued by health_problems the_last_two_years of her_life . She died on November_1_,_1912 in Toronto at the_age of 30 .
